Thought experiment.
What's the worst that could happen if we allowed anyone to use Registror to trigger a release of a package?
Rather than just people with permissions. :thread:

messages.text:
after yesterdays release I got
```Triggering TagBot for merged registry pull request

This extra notification is being sent because I expected a tag to exist by now, but it doesn't.
You may want to check your TagBot configuration to ensure that it's running, and if it is, check the logs to make sure that there are no errors.```
from TagBot (<https://github.com/kalmarek/Cyclotomics.jl/issues/9#issuecomment-749509414>) and the release was not created; I did create tag manually, but maybe there's a better way to solve it?

elements.text: after yesterdays release I got

Triggering TagBot for merged registry pull request

This extra notification is being sent because I expected a tag to exist by now, but it doesn't.
You may want to check your TagBot configuration to ensure that it's running, and if it is, check the logs to make sure that there are no errors.
from TagBot (
) and the release was not created; I did create tag manually, but maybe there's a better way to solve it?

Can’t we make it automerge on CI completion?

messages.text:
<https://docs.github.com/en/free-pro-team@latest/actions/reference/workflow-syntax-for-github-actions#onschedule>

> The shortest interval you can run scheduled workflows is once every 5 minutes.
12 minutes should be ok, but...

elements.text: The shortest interval you can run scheduled workflows is once every 5 minutes.
12 minutes should be ok, but...

messages.text:
Sure, if they respected the times that would be Ok.
(12 minutes is a bit long for my taste but only by 2 minutes)
but since they don’t respect the times, then as a hack making it try more often might work?

elements.text:
